learning_outcomes.description: Apply knowledge of aspects of health promotion strategies to a relevant health behaviour and population group.
Locate and critically appraise relevant evidence to justify the need for a specific health promotion strategy for a selected population group.
Demonstrate an understanding of the purpose and process of conducting a needs assessment to inform the development of a health promotion strategy.
Select and synthesise relevant inputs (e.g. evidence, resources) for the development, implementation, and evaluation of health promotion strategies.
Apply the Program Logic Model framework to critically review a proposed health promotion program and develop a program evaluation plan.
Demonstrate effective skills in written and verbal health communication.

assessments.task_description:
You are part of the program design team for your non-government organisation and your team is preparing to conduct a needs assessment to support a new health promotion strategy. You are required to develop a research protocol that will inform how the needs assessment is conducted. An important initial step is to review and summarise what is already known about the target population and health behaviour being addressed, including factors that may impact behaviour change. This provides a foundation for the remaining sections of the research protocol, including the research aims and rationale, sampling and recruitment, data collection, administrative data sources, and ethical considerations.


Specific instructions for this assignment are available in the Blackboard course site under 'Assessment'.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Please follow the submission instructions on the course site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Assessment 2: Appraisal of a Health Promotion Strategy - Oral Presentation and Examination
assessments.due_date:
17/04/2026 - 24/04/2026

The written script (for the Oral Presentation) is on Friday 17th April 2026, by 2 pm.
assessments.task_description:
You have recently accepted a graduate position with a non-government organisation (NGO) that works to improve community and population health in the areas of physical activity, dietary behaviour, and alcohol and other drug use. The team is in the planning stages for development of a new health promotion strategy involving a specific population group and health behaviour. To support the strategy development, you have been tasked with appraising examples of previous strategies, focused on the same population group and health behaviour, from which the team could draw key learnings.

Your task is to critically appraise a published study of a relevant health behaviour strategy, summarising key learnings of the study and reflecting on the study outcomes, to form the basis for recommendations about the new strategy. You will present your appraisal and recommendations to the NGO leadership group, who will then ask you a series of questions to gain a deeper understanding of your appraisal and recommendations.

The Oral Presentation comprises Part A of this assessment item (weighting: 30%), and the Oral Examination comprises Part B (Pass/Fail). The Oral Examination will follow immediately after the Presentation.

It is recommended that the health behaviour and population you select are the same as those you chose for Assessment 1 (Needs Assessment Research Protocol).

Specific instructions for this assessment item are available in the Blackboard course site under 'Assessment'.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Please follow the submission instructions on the course site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Assessment 3 - Health Promotion Program Logic Model
assessments.task_description:
As part of your internship at a non-government organisation, you are part of a team working on a new health promotion program. To support program development, you are required to develop a program logic model and evaluation plan that considers program development processes and outcomes. Your supervisor has asked you to submit your plan in a structured report.


Specific instructions for this assignment are available in the Blackboard course site under 'Assessment'.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Please follow the submission instructions on the course site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
